column4: iknonia, that was my isp dieing, and my secondary nick is my away nick, once i ghosted my standard i /nick 'ed
still don't need an "away" nick
i dont use it in this chan
you just did, hence the message
that was no different than an alternate nick in case of ghost or nick takeover
it just happened to be |zZzZ
nice changes for away / sleeping / alternative nics are not really appriciated

that was not a nick change for sleeping or away, that was my internet dieing and rebel_kid disconnecting, then x chat reconnecting under an alternate because rebel_kid was a ghost, after ghosting i nicked back to rebel_kid that had nothing to do with being away or sleeping
why are you arguing this, it was just a polite request
i found it rude, seeing as how the message "rebel_kid quit(nick collission from services)" came first
thats your issue to deal with then, just because your connection died, you had another "away" nick idling
you would have seen the same messages had the alternate been rebel_kid_
yes
ls -la
what user name are you trying to use
what is the exact password prompt say
An application wants to access the private key id_rsa" but it is locked"
check the permissions on your id_dsa file in your home dir
permissions are all me and its in ~/.ssh
check what the permissions are though, not the owner
change it to 600 for me please
it may sound silly but key permissions are very fussy
same story
ok - so what command are you using to ssh in
sorry to be specific, but it helps to know
ssh freecoders@67.42.176.67 -p 2222
ok try this ssh -vv freecoders@67.42.176.67 -p 2222
same story only with a lot more readout
pastebint the output please.
http://pastebin.ca/1233864
give me a minue to look
np
ahh there we have it
wow that was fast
your key is not valid
the locked message is a read herring
local or remote? and how do i create a new one
well this looks like your local private key is messed up
can it be recreated?
it also looks like it's trying to use id_rsa rather than id_dsa
what is in your ~.ssh dir
id_rsa  id_rsa.keystore  id_rsa.pub  known_hosts
ahh ha, thats interesting
so the application wants to use dsa but you've got an rsa key
i cant even remember making that key, i just finished setup on the remote, didnt do a thing to the local
run "file" against rsa_id
and it is asking for "id_rsa"
ahh sorry, I thought it was asking for id_dsa, my mistake
got two no such file or directory errors (one for against and one for rsa_id) must have run your command wrong
one moment please
look at the first line of your id_rsa look like this -----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
yeah looks exactly like that
ehck for spaces at the end of that line
none
look at lines 09/12 in your pastebin poit and it looks like the descriptor line is on 4 lines rather than one
(assuming im understanding) i have a single line descriptor with no spaces at the end
well yes and no, your errors conflict with line 70
im a bit confused by this, im not sure what your telling me
I'll go through it with you now, but the bottom line is your key "looks" corrupt
got the pastebin
lets go through it
got it
ok
but scroll down to line 56-59 that makes the key look good
alright
line 70 also shows a valid id_rsa key
followign so far ?
following
then go down to 74 - it tries a non-existant key (.ssh/identify) fails on that and moes onto your key (.ssh/id_rsa)
ok
76 - it sends the key but something happens as it doesn't like the response/key and moves on to try id_dsa which you don't have and then tries a straight password
yeah
that something is what can't be explained
ok, i understand now, but what do i do?
my personal feeling is deelte your key directorys stuff as you've got a few odd files in there, re-create the keys and re-set it up
thats my personal feeling, it will only take 10 minutes
your talking locally right? and just rm -rf the ~/.ssh directory?
not the whole directory no
just all the keys?
you'll need to do this locally, but you'll need to get your new public key put on the target server
yeah, just the keys
id_rsa.pub is a key i sent over from the remote, delete that and resend?
delete *rsa* - recreate new private/public keys and re-send the .pub key
so i need to create new keys remote and local?

no you need to create a public and a private key locally and put the public key you created locally on any host you wantt o access remotly in the authorized_keys file on the remote host in your home/.sh dir
you may find this useful http://www.laubenheimer.net/ssh-keys.shtml
ty
got it workin thanks so much
good man
should still work
thank you, have a good day :)
